name: 2-amino-4-methoxybenzothiazole
Reason: 2-Amino-4-methoxybenzothiazole has a melting point that is influenced by several functional groups. The basic unit for comparison can be benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5°C. The methoxy group introduces additional molecular weight and hydrogen bonding potential, raising the melting point by approximately +10°C. The amino group introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, raising the melting point by approximately +20°C. The thiazole ring introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, raising the melting point by approximately +30°C. The methoxy group also introduces additional molecular weight and hydrogen bonding potential, raising the melting point by approximately +10°C. Summing up these changes: Benzene base (+5.5°C), one methoxy group (+10°C), one amino group (+20°C), and one thiazole ring (+30°C).
